Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Genetic Art using NEAT

X-Yahoo-Profile: mattias_fagerlund

Hey Ken!
 
> I think it's a really cool app as well, though as you say it's been 
> done before with different evolutionary methods.  But I think 
> interactive evolution has a lot of potential in the future.

And it's good fun. I used to have a web site were users could evolve
online, but that died and I lost most of the source.

Actually, GP is better suited for this kind of thing - NN produces nicer
images faster, but GP can do color way better. The reason GP can evolve
color better is that it can evolve programs that work with quartenions -
which in turn means that R G and B are tightly co-related. With NN I can
use three output nodes (R G and B or H S and V), but ultimately, the
output nodes are to un-related for the images to have any impact.

> Anyway, I'm wondering, are your networks recurrent, in which case 
> the order in which you present coordinates would matter in a kind of 
> strange way?  

I allow recurrent networks and I perform a few iterations for each pixel.
But I flush the network before each new pixel because otherwise the image
becomes chaotic.

> An idea your project brought to my mind was maybe a "roving eye"-
> like artist could be evolved: It could start out in the middle and 
> just decide on its own which directions to draw in and how much ink 
> to drop at each step.  You could feed it coordinates as well, but it 
> would decide on the order it to visit them.  

That's an idea. Perhaps something for the roving eye people?

cheers,
mattias
